thread.title: Manchester City's Ilkay Gundogan targets the START of pre-season for his return from knee injury
thread.title_full: Manchester City's Ilkay Gundogan targets the START of pre-season for his return from knee injury

author: Neil Rowlands
title: Manchester City's Ilkay Gundogan targets the START of pre-season for his return from knee injury
text:
Gundogan hasn't played since being injured against Watford on December 14 Share   
Ilkay Gundogan has circled the first day of Manchester City 's pre-season training for a potential return to action. 
Germany international Gundogan was having an impressive debut season in English football, until suffering damage to cruciate knee ligaments in December that required season-ending surgery. 
Now, the 26-year-old midfielder, a Â£20million signing from Borussia Dortmund, has written an Instagram post including a photo of him lofting weights with his legs and given an update on his rehab. 
He said: "It is getting better. It is a little bit frustrating, but injuries are part of football. 
"Unfortunately my injury is a long-term injury, it takes quite a few months to recover, but I am okay with that. That is fine for me, I work hard. 
"I just try to do the best every day and try to come back as soon as possible on the field. Hopefully I can start pre-season." 
Gundogan was talking in New York, where he and also-injured City forward Gabriel Jesus were promoting City's matches in the International Champions Cup this summer. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
